results.title: A Word to the wise
results.brief_description: Carelessness with an electric iron, a cigarette, or a radiator can start a fire in your home, or in your next door neighbour’s home. This film demonstrates how to take precautions against such common domestic fire hazards and provides statistical information on just how easily fires can start. Entertaining and informative narration.

results.title: A Wonderful construction
results.brief_description: Discusses the lack of job satisfaction on construction sites in America since the depression. Through commentary and interview, compares this with the ideal city as envisaged by the French artist, Fernand Leger in his painting “Les Constructeurs”. Written and photographed by Don Lenzer. Music by Erik Satie and Frank Zappa.

results.title: A Way of caring
results.brief_description: A record of a typical day in the lives of a group of seventeen severely mentally handicapped children who live in a small hostel on the outskirts of a large provincial town. Shows how the individual attention of the six housemothers and the home atmosphere of the hostel, is reflected in the children’s behaviour.

results.title: A Walk in the park
results.brief_description: A film designed to stimulate discussion amount young people on the problem of drug abuse. It presents the momentary world to three young people, whose life style may appear rather unorthodox. The film presents non-moralizing, realistic episode open to a wide range of interpretations.

results.title: A Tribute to Sir Winston Churchill, K.G.
results.brief_description: A biographical film in honour of Sir Winston Churchill’s 80th birthday, dealing with his early life, education and his emergence into public life. It goes on to recall details of his political career, particularly as Britain’s leader throughout the war years, and ends with the presentation made to him by the two Houses of Parliament at a ceremony in Westminster Hall on the occasion of his 80th birthday.

results.title: A Time to look forward
results.creator_credit: Ronald Dunkley, Gerard Holdsworth and Post Office Telecommunications
results.brief_description: Four case histories show the activities that can be taken up in retirement - part-time job, moving to the country, gardening or hobbies - and also the problems encountered in retirement.

results.title: A Time sequence record of the Ash Wednesday fires using news reports as broadcast during the emergency
results.brief_description: A Channel 10 Production on Wednesday 16th 1983 of the Ash Wednesday Bushfires opening with David Johnston on location in the Dandenong Ranges. The report also includes the fires around Adelaide in South Australia with 5DN journalist Murray Nicoll reporting on the situation including the destruction of his own home. Victoria and South Australia suffered extensive damage and loss during the Ash Wednesday Fires which claimed the lives of 75 people, 13 of these were firemen. The devastating fires also claimed 264,000 sheep, 16,690 cattle and 2031 homes.

results.title: A Time for Georgia
results.brief_description: Describes the pathology of a four-year-old autistic child. Characteristic behaviour of this syndrome is clearly presented, as well as the gains such a child can make in a therapeutic nursery. Filmed at a community-based, therapeutic nursery-kindergarten.
